alert.note: Alert for Southern Franklin; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Franklin and west central Essex Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wawbeek, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Placid, Saranac Lake, Wawbeek, Mount Marcy, North Elba, Mount Van Hoevenberg, Ray Brook, Mount Van Hoevenburg Recreation Area, Axton Landing, and Coreys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
